title: Ravens-Steelers on SNF to cap Week 18 slate
content: The NFL announced the full final-weekend schedule, with the marquee matchup between the Ravens and Steelers set to take place on "Sunday Night Football" on NBC, with the winner making the playoffs.

title: Purdy 'playing as good as it gets'; 49ers eye 1-seed
content: For the second week in a row, QB Brock Purdy accounted for five touchdowns as the 49ers outlasted the Bears 42-38 in a wild shootout on "Sunday Night Football" to set up a Week 18 showdown with the Seahawks for the NFC's top seed.

title: Kawhi puts up career-high 55 for streaking Clips
content: Kawhi Leonard scored a career-high 55 points as the Clippers extended their winning streak with a victory over the Eastern Conference-leading Pistons.

title: Pats clinch AFC East; Bills' reign ends with loss
content: The Patriots clinched their first division title since 2019 on Sunday, dismantling the Jets behind Drake Maye and then watching the Bills fall to the Eagles.

title: Garrett: Steelers' focus more on me than winning
content: Myles Garrett didn't set the NFL's single-season sacks record Sunday, but he believes the Steelers were more worried about preventing his record than getting the win.

title: Rivers: No regrets, even with Colts 0-3 in return
content: Philip Rivers says he has no regrets about unretiring even though the Colts have gone 0-3 in his starts.

title: LeBron, Luka 'set the tone' as Lakers right ship
content: With the Lakers reeling from a three-game slide, a calf injury to Austin Reaves and an air-it-out team meeting coming into Sunday's game against the Kings, LeBron James and Luka Doncic led a dominant 125-101 win to help right the ship for L.A.

title: Tank talk rubs Raiders wrong way amid latest loss
content: Raiders players' displeasure regarding the talk of tanking hovering over the organization intensified after a 34-10 loss to the Giants on Sunday.

title: ðŸ‘€ How to do two coaching jobs during the CFP
content: Multiple CFP teams have coordinators taking head jobs elsewhere. For them, it's about compartmentalizing the chaos.

title: Tyler Shough for Rookie of Year? The Saints' QB is making his case
content: Sunday's win marked the fifth for the New Orleans signal-caller in just his eighth game as a starter.

title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (22!), Broncos' D (64!)
content: The Browns' vet edge rusher and Denver's defense have one week to rewrite the single-season sacks record book.

title: Despite red zone issues, Jaguars are one win from AFC South title
content: After a close win at the Colts, the Jaguars need a victory against the Titans in Week 18 to secure the division title.

title: Week 17 winners and losers: Maye, Henry shine in fantasy finals; Gibbs, Lamb disappoint
content: Drake Maye, Derrick Henry and Chase Brown came up big when it mattered most in Week 17, while Jahmyr Gibbs and CeeDee Lamb were among the biggest disappointments.

title: 'Thank you Browns': Ravens give shoutout to rival for saving season
content: Baltimore now controls its division fate after Cleveland stunned Pittsburgh -- and the Ravens made sure to say thanks.

title: Ian Darke's Best XI: Who stands out halfway through the season?
content: Will it be Donnarumma or Raya for best goalkeeper? Which two Sunderland players are in? Here are the season's top players as we near the halfway point.

title: Despite leading the league, Arsenal haven't looked convincing
content: Arsenal relied on an own goal for the fourth-straight game and their win vs. Brighton saw them do just enough.

title: The winner takes it all: Inside NFL division battles at the sportsbooks
content: At least two NFL divisions will be contested for during Week 18 of the NFL season after a wild Week 17.

title: Why Raiders' Alex Bachman lives in a guesthouse and has no attachments
content: Alex Bachman once found his locker empty before game day. Now he lives by rentals and no attachments.

title: A new United States champ; Three Stages of Hell for Rhodes vs. McIntyre
content: Friday's "SmackDown" saw a new champion being crowned and the Cody Rhodes-Drew McIntyre rivalry reaching a new level.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid rebuff Napoli's Mastantuono move
content: Napoli want Real Madrid midfielder Franco Mastantuono on loan, but he won't be allowed to move this month. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 2 Women From Telangana Killed In Car Crash In California
content: Two women from Telangana died in a road accident in the United States late Saturday evening, police said.

title: 'Age No Barrier For Fame': Boomer Influencers Take Over Social Media
content: After years of boomer-bashing, it's the ultimate flex. From fashion to beauty to fitness and lifestyle, the rise of the silver content creator is sending a powerful message: Age is no barrier to having cachet.

title: "Can We Just Do America": Ex-Trump Ally On Meetings With Zelensky, Netanyahu
content: Donald Trump met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Sunday and is scheduled to meet Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday.

title: Burning Homes, Locked Doors: Hindu Family Wakes Up To Horror In Bangladesh
content: Amid increasing violence against minorities in Bangladesh, at least five houses of a Hindu family were set on fire in Dumritala village in the Muslim-dominated nation's Pirojpur district.

title: Highlights: Supreme Court Stays New Aravallis Definition, Unnao Rape Convict's Bail On Hold
content: The Supreme Court stayed the new definition of the Aravallis, while ordering the formation of a high-powered committee to conduct a multi-temporal investigation of the Aravalli hills and mountain ranges.

title: South Korea's Ex-First Lady Took Bags, Jewellery Worth Rs 1.8 Crore As Bribes
content: Kim Keon Hee, the former first lady of South Korea, has been accused of accepting more than $2,00,000 (approx. Rs 1.80 crore) worth of bribes and illegally intervening in state affairs.

title: Bleeding In Brain, Damage To Spine: Tripura Student's Medical Report
content: The medical report of a student from Tripura, who was murdered for raising his voice against racist comments, showed he suffered bleeding in the brain.

title: Class 11 Student Dies After Falling From Restaurant Rooftop In Delhi
content: A 16-year-old boy lost his life after falling from a plastic shed at a restaurant in Delhi's Gujranwala Town, police said on Monday. The incident took place on Sunday evening when the teenager had gone out with his friends.

title: Bangladesh Unrest: Osman Hadi's Party's "24-Day Ultimatum" To Yunus Regime
content: Sharif Osman Bin Hadi's party, Inqilab Moncho, has given a "24-day ultimatum" to the Muhammed Yunus-led interim government to complete the trial in the murder of 32-year-old youth leaders and bring all those involved in his killing to justice.

title: Watch: Frustrated Farmers Protest In 'Sholay'-Style Over Crop Damage Aid In Nashik
content: A group of frustrated farmers held a protest against the local officials over alleged irregularities and favouritism in crop damage compensation.

title: An LK Advani Twist In Supreme Court Hearing On Unnao Rape Convict's Bail
content: The Supreme Court on Monday stepped in to halt the release of former Uttar Pradesh MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar, staying a Delhi High Court order that had suspended his life sentence and granted him bail in the 2017 Unnao rape case.

title: Caught Cheating In Exam, 19-Year-Old Jaipur Student Jumps Off 12th Floor
content: A 19-year-old college student here allegedly jumped off from the 12th floor of an under-construction building after he was caught cheating in an exam, police said on Sunday.

title: Mumbai Woman Loses Over Rs 3 Crore By Scammers Posing As "Judge Chandrachud"
content: A 68-year-old retired woman in Mumbai has been duped of over Rs 3 crore by fraudsters who put her under 'digital arrest' by impersonating former Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud and officials from the CBI and the police.

title: Amid War Of Words, A Handshake Between Revanth Reddy And KCR
content: The Telangana Assembly on Monday witnessed a rare moment of bonhomie as Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy exchanged pleasantries with his predecessor and Leader of Opposition K. Chandrasekhar Rao.

title: Rapper-Turned-Mayor, Balendra Shah, To Run For PM In Nepal
content: Rapper turned-Kathmandu mayor Balendra Shah, known as Balen, a popular elected official, joined the Rastriya Swatantra Party (RSP) or national independent party, led by a former TV host-turned politician Rabi Lamichhane on Sunday.

title: Tamil Nadu Teens Attack Migrant Worker With Machetes, Pose Next To Him With Victory Sign
content: Three accused were sent to a juvenile home in Chengalpattu, while the fourth one was released on bail, with the court citing his studies.

title: Rift Within Bangladesh's Student-Led Party Widens Over Jamaat Alliance
content: National Citizen Party (NCP) members said a Jamaat alliance goes against the party's ideology and democratic values.

title: Expert Panel, Multi-Period Probe: Key Takeaways From Supreme Court's Aravalli Order
content: The Supreme Court ordered the formation of a high-powered committee comprising domain experts to undertake an exhaustive and holistic examination of the issue.

title: Canada's Healthcare In Focus After Indian Man Dies Post 8-Hour Hospital Wait
content: The death of a 44-year-old Indian origin man in Canada -- who allegedly passed away without receiving emergency care despite an eight-hour wait at an Edmonton hospital -- has put focus on the Canadian healthcare system

title: Sydney Hero Recounts Moment-By-Moment How He Stopped Bondi Beach Shooter
content: Sydney shop owner Ahmed al Ahmed has recounted the harrowing moment he confronted one of the gunmen during the Bondi Beach attack in Australia that left 15 people dead.

title: China outfits cargo ship with missiles: Beijing's sinister Taiwan war plan revealed - see pics
content: China is transforming its cargo ship, Zhongda 79, into an arsenal ship, equipping it with containerized launchers for up to 60 missiles. This upgrade, featuring advanced weaponry including hypersonic missiles, signifies Beijing's push to bolster its naval capabilities and match the US Navy's vertical launch systems. The vessel's transformation highlights China's growing maritime ambitions.

title: 'Stand committed': Forest min reacts to SC Aravalli ruling; what he said on mining
content: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to stay its order on the Aravalli range's "new definition." The court has formed a committee to re-examine the issues. The government remains committed to protecting and restoring the Aravalli hills, with mining bans on new and renewed leases continuing. This follows widespread criticism of the previous definition.

title: Confirmed: Kohli to play 3rd Vijay Hazare Trophy match for Delhi; date, venue revealed
content: While the BCCI has mandated centrally contracted players to feature in at least two matches, Virat Kohli has opted to play a third game as part of his preparation for the upcoming home series against New Zealand. Kohli has been in fine form in his first two appearances for Delhi, scoring 131 and 77 respectively.

title: 'I'll ensure Sengar gets death': Unnao rape survivor after SC ruling, says fight still on
content: The Unnao rape survivor expressed joy and vowed to pursue capital punishment after the Supreme Court stayed the Delhi High Court's order suspending expelled BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar's life sentence. The apex court's decision prevents Sengar's release, emphasizing the peculiar circumstances of his conviction for a grave offense. The survivor conveyed her faith in the judiciary's pursuit of justice.

title: China moves to rival SpaceX: Stock market rules eased; reusable rockets in focus
content: China is accelerating its reusable rocket ambitions, offering a fast-track IPO route on its STAR market for companies developing this technology. New regulations waive traditional financial hurdles, focusing instead on achieving key milestones like successful orbital launches. This strategic move aims to challenge SpaceX's dominance in cost-effective space access and bolster China's own space capabilities.

title: Live-fire war games: China launches drills around Taiwan; Taipei mobilises forces
content: China launched large-scale live-fire military drills around Taiwan, deploying warships and aircraft in a stern warning to independence supporters and foreign powers. Taiwan's military is on high alert, vowing to defend its democracy amid drills aimed at blockading key ports and simulating strikes.

title: 'Unsatisfactory' pitch: Will MCG face ban after demerit point? What ICC rule says
content: "The pitch at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the venue for the fourth Ashes Test, has been deemed â€˜Unsatisfactoryâ€™ with the venue handed one demerit point under the ICC Pitch and Outfield Monitoring Process," the ICC said in a statement. An unsatisfactory rating is the third level in the ICCâ€™s four-tier system.

title: â€˜AI agents are becoming a problemâ€™: OpenAI CEO flags risks; offers $555K role
content: OpenAI is hiring a high-paid Head of Preparedness amid growing fears of AI systems exploiting security flaws and harming mental well-being. CEO Sam Altman acknowledged models are finding critical vulnerabilities, while also highlighting AI's potential psychological impact. The role will tackle cybersecurity, biosecurity, and self-improving AI risks, a crucial step as AI's dual nature becomes apparent.

title: Missiles, radars & loiter munition: Centre clears mega Rs 79K cr defence deal; what's on list
content: The Defence Acquisition Council has approved capital acquisition proposals totaling approximately Rs 79,000 crore to enhance the operational capabilities of the Armed Forces. These approvals, granted on December 29, 2025, cover a variety of equipment for the Army, Navy, and Air Force, including loiter munition systems, radars, guided rocket ammunition, and drone detection systems.

title: Gold, silver price today: How much these precious metals cost in your city
content: Silver experienced a record-breaking rally, hitting fresh highs on strong investor demand and global cues, though it saw a dip as investors booked profits. Gold prices remained near record levels domestically, while overseas markets saw minor declines due to profit-taking.  Local prices for both precious metals are also provided.

title: CEO of most popular AI coding tool warns: Close your eyes to code; watch everything crumble
content: The CEO of AI coding startup Cursor is sounding the alarm about relying too heavily on AI for software development, dubbing it 'vibe coding.' He emphasizes that while AI is a powerful assistant, developers absolutely need to grasp the code's intricacies.  Ignoring this can lead to shaky foundations for sophisticated applications, despite AI's growing presence in coding.

title: IPO review: Only half of total listings end positively in '25â€” Check details
content: India's 2025 IPO market saw record fundraising but a reality check emerged as many stocks failed to sustain initial hype. While 69 companies listed above issue prices, only 54 remained positive by year-end. Experts advise investors to focus on fundamentals and track post-listing performance, especially for smaller issues, as quality is now being differentiated from mere sentiment.

title: 'We are worried': What SC said on convict Sengar's bail; the 'public servant' question
content: The Supreme Court has intervened in the Unnao rape case. It has halted the Delhi high court's decision to suspend former BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar's life sentence. The apex court is examining if an MLA qualifies as a public servant under the POCSO Act. This move ensures Sengar remains in jail. The survivor welcomes the Supreme Court's action.

title: 5 hidden beaches to visit in India for some peace in 2026
content: Escape the crowds and discover India's serene hidden beaches in 2026. From Goa's Butterfly Beach to Odisha's Chandipur, these tranquil shores offer a peaceful retreat. Lakshadweep's Minicoy, Karnataka's Om Beach, and Kerala's Perumathura also provide unhurried moments by the sea, perfect for rejuvenation and quiet contemplation away from the usual tourist hustle.

title: Travis Kelce: I let Andy Reid down during Chiefs' tough season
content: Kansas City Chiefs fans experienced an unfamiliar season of losses and missed playoffs in 2025, a stark contrast to years of dominance.  Veteran Travis Kelce expressed deep disappointment, feeling he let down coach Andy Reid, highlighting their strong bond and his unwavering sense of responsibility to the team and his mentor.

title: MLB trade rumors: Mets eye $10M Phillies star; Brandon Nimmo in focus
content: The New York Mets are reportedly signing veteran outfielder Max Kepler to a one-year deal, aiming for a cost-effective solution after trading Brandon Nimmo. Kepler offers defensive reliability and left-handed power, fitting the Mets' strategy of maintaining roster stability and payroll flexibility while preparing for top prospect Carson Benge's eventual rise.

title: Horror on Nainital highway: Scrap truck topples onto Bolero, crushing UP power dept driver
content: A driver for the Uttar Pradesh power department was killed when a truck carrying wooden scrap overturned on the Nainital Highway in Rampur. The truck rammed a divider while trying to avoid the Bolero, crushing it completely. The driver, Firasat, was pulled from the wreckage but declared dead at the hospital.

title: Dhurandhar: Naseem Mughal on viral assault scene with Ranveer Singh
content: Naseem Mughal, who plays Lulli in 'Dhurandhar', initially refused to shoot an intense assault scene with Ranveer Singh due to nervousness. However, the film's team and Singh himself made him comfortable, allowing him to deliver a powerful performance that has since gone viral.

title: Bengaluru businessman held for duping woman of Rs 75 lakh; rapes her minor sister
content: Bagalagunte police arrested Subham Shukla, a 27-year-old textile businessman. He is accused of cheating a woman of gold and cash exceeding Rs 75 lakh. Shukla also allegedly raped her 16-year-old sister. The victims' father filed the complaint. Shukla has been remanded in judicial custody. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Silver prices drop Rs 21,000 in an hour after hitting life-time high
content: Silver price crash today: Silver prices saw a sharp drop after hitting record highs, with MCX futures plunging Rs 21,000 per kg as profit booking set in amid easing geopolitical risks and higher margin requirements.

title: Unnao rape case: SC stays Delhi HC order granting bail to Kuldeep Sengar; ex-BJP MLA to remain in jail
content: The Supreme Court has halted the Delhi High Court's bail order for ex-BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar in the Unnao rape case.  The apex court questioned the suspension of his sentence, noting Sengar remains jailed for another conviction. The CBI had appealed the bail, highlighting the horrific nature of the crime against a minor.

title: IT hiring in 2025: The boom is real, but not the one engineering students were waiting for
content: Indiaâ€™s IT job market is growing again in 2025, but the recovery looks different from the one engineering students were expecting. Hiring is rising, yet employers are prioritising experienced professionals, niche digital skills, and immediate readiness over mass campus recruitment. For fresh graduates, the boom existsâ€”but its doors are narrower, and entry requires more than a degree.

title: World record! Bhutan bowler scripts history; becomes first to do the unthinkable
content: Bhutan's Sonam Yeshey made T20 International history by becoming the first bowler to take an eight-wicket haul, finishing with figures of 8 for 7 against Myanmar. This extraordinary spell dismantled Myanmar's chase, securing an 82-run victory for Bhutan and an unassailable series lead. Yeshey's performance surpasses all previous T20 International records.

title: 'Why are you attacking Hindus in B'desh?': Bengal vendor assaulted by mob in Odisha; rescued by cops
content: A street vendor from West Bengal, Arshad Mallik, was brutally assaulted and accused of being an illegal Bangladeshi migrant in Odisha.  He was rescued by police after a video of the incident went viral.  With assistance from a state minister and local police, Mallik was safely brought back home.

title: 'Horrific': Rahul condemns Tripura student's killing in Dehradun; accuses BJP of 'normalising' hate
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi blamed the BJP for the fatal assault on Tripura student Anjel Chakma in Dehradun, calling it a "horrific hate crime" fueled by "toxic content and irresponsible narratives." Chakma succumbed to injuries sustained in a December 9th assault.

title: 'I thought I was the next Steve Jobs': Google founder's 'mindset' lesson for students
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin revealed a key lesson from the Google Glass failure: rushing innovation can be detrimental. He emphasized that students, like his past self, often feel pressured to deliver before readiness, mistaking speed for progress. True success, Brin suggests, lies in allowing ideas and skills adequate time to mature, rather than performing readiness.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection: Ranveer Singh starrer nears Rs 700cr on day 25
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its strong box office run, nearing the Rs. 700 crore mark on its 25th day with over Rs. 3 crore collected. In contrast, 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Teri Tu Mera,' starring Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday, is struggling, earning just Rs. 0.56 crore on its fifth day and standing at Rs. 24.06 crore domestically.

title: Indus Waters Treaty put on hold, govt clears another Chenab hydel project
content: India is advancing its hydropower potential on the Chenab River with the approval of the 260 MW Dulhasti State-II project in Jammu & Kashmir. This strategic move, following the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, aims to harness the river's untapped capacity. The project, an extension of an existing facility, will contribute to India's hydropower generation goals.

title: Income tax emails rattle taxpayers! Refunds, ITR processing on hold - Whatâ€™s happening?
content: Income Tax Department has been sending emails and SMSes warning that return processing and refunds are on hold due to flagged donations or deduction claims. These have unsettled taxpayers, particularly those with genuine claims.

title: Tiff turns violent: Drunk teens slash Odisha youth with sickles; post assault video online
content: A shocking incident unfolded near Tiruttani where a group of juveniles brutally attacked a 20-year-old Odia youth with sickles, filming the assault for social media. The victim, K Suraj, sustained severe injuries. Police apprehended the attackers, who were found drinking at a temple, and have registered a case of attempt to murder.

title: Emergency crews rush to house fire at Denny Hamlinâ€™s parentsâ€™ home
content: A massive house fire erupted Sunday night at the Gaston County, North Carolina, home of NASCAR Cup Series star Denny Hamlin's parents. Two individuals were transported to a local hospital after being removed from the property. Firefighters battled difficult conditions, including a lack of hydrants, to control the blaze.

title: Hidden health risks of office coffee machines you should know about
content: Your office coffee machine might be a hidden health hazard. Unfiltered brews can elevate cholesterol due to compounds like cafestol and kahweol. Poor hygiene also poses microbial contamination risks. Opt for filtered coffee and ensure machines are regularly cleaned to mitigate these potential cardiovascular and respiratory issues. Stay informed about your daily brew.

title: Tech in 2026: The era of AI coworker and Connected Intelligence beckons
content: By 2026, AI will transition from a talking tool to an autonomous partner, managing tasks and workflows across industries. India is poised to lead this 'AI public infrastructure' revolution, with significant investments in cloud and AI capabilities. Expect a future where AI agents work alongside humans, enhancing productivity and driving measurable outcomes.

title: 'Mandhana threatened never to speak to Harmanpreet': Jemimah reveals why
content: India womenâ€™s team captain Harmanpreet Kaur broke into a bhangra while lifting the Womenâ€™s T20 World Cup trophy, a moment that soon went viral and won hearts across social media. The celebratory act, however, had a light-hearted story behind it.

title: Indiaâ€™s coaching centres come under mental-health regulation: What changed & why it matters
content: Noida administration is enforcing stricter rules for coaching centres. Student well-being is now a top priority. Institutions must ensure disciplined environments and adequate facilities. Trained counselors will be mandatory. CCTV cameras are required in all centres. This move follows national concerns about academic pressure and student suicides. Compliance is expected within 15 days.

title: VHT: RCB's Rs 7cr buy fails to fire; falls cheaply after huge mix up
content: Venkatesh Iyerâ€™s dismissal came after a costly mix-up with Himanshu Mantri while attempting a quick single, leaving him short of the crease. The early exit once again brought focus on the 30-year-old, who has been under scrutiny following an eventful IPL auction cycle.

title: Woman beaten to death by husband, sister-in-law in Maharashtra
content: A shocking domestic dispute in Palghar's Virar West led to the alleged murder of 35-year-old Kalpana Soni. Her husband, Mahesh Soni, and sister-in-law, Deepali Soni, were arrested after a heated argument over dowry turned violent. The victim was reportedly attacked with a sharp weapon, and despite initial claims of an accident, medical reports confirmed foul play.

title: How honeymoon in Sri Lanka led to suicide of Bengaluru couple 1,000km apart
content: A 30-year-old man, facing dowry harassment and abetment to suicide charges after his wife's death, died by suicide in a Nagpur hotel. He had fled Bengaluru with his family due to threats from his in-laws. His mother also attempted suicide but survived.

title: Nagarjuna describes 2025 as â€˜very satisfyingâ€™; â€˜Glad sons found their happinessâ€™
content: Actor Nagarjuna reflects on 2025 as a deeply satisfying year, marked by his sons' marriages and personal happiness. Professionally, he relished working with Dhanush and Rajinikanth, even embracing a villainous role in 'Coolie.' The re-release of his iconic film 'Shiva' also brought immense joy and reconnected with a new generation.

title: Selvaperunthagai slams Praveen Chakravartyâ€™s â€˜T.N. debt levelâ€™ remark; files complaint with AICC
content: Mr. Chakravarty on Sunday disputed the claim of DMK Parliamentary party leader Kanimozhi, that the M.K. Stalin government had transformed the debt-burdened Tamil Nadu into a developed State

title: ED conducts searches in Delhi, Haryana in coercive private loan settlements case
content: Investigations were initiated based on more than 15 FIRs and chargesheets filed by the police in Haryana and U.P. against the accused, â€˜aÂ known strongman involved in criminal activities like murder, extortion, coerciveÂ settlements of loans...â€™, the ED stated

title: â€˜Bulldozer politicsâ€™ row: Kerala CM takes on Karnataka over Bengaluru eviction drive
content: The statements of Kerala CM and AICC general secretary after an eviction drive in Bengaluru are seen as part of a narrative building exercise ahead of Assembly elections in Kerala expected early next year.

title: Kochi Mayor unveils 50-day action plan ahead of Assembly polls
content: V.K. Minimol says action plan will aim at finding solutions to multiple challenges, including waterlogging, waste management, mosquito eradication, and stray dog menace

title: Keep aside differences, work unitedly with Sena (UBT) to save Mumbai: Raj to MNS cadre
content: "Keep your differences aside to save Mumbai. Party workers and local functionaries must take part in the campaigning of Shiv Sena (UBT) and NCP (SP) candidates, and the same will be reciprocated by the Shiv Sena (UBT)," says Raj Thackeray

title: One dies as overloaded truck mounts divider, topples onto SUV in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur
content: Police from multiple stations, senior officers and fire services were present at the spot to manage rescue and traffic operations

title: Speak up against hate crimes: Sibal to Shah on Tripura student killing
content: The Independent Rajya Sabha MP said the incident was a shocking display of a hate crime, bigotry and the "silence of leaders in government who by their inaction are complicit"

title: One-year-old dies after choking on stone in Keralaâ€™s Malappuram
content: The child swallowed several small stones while playing in the courtyard of his house. One of the stones became lodged in his throat, leading to his death

title: Welcome SC order on Aravallis, formation of new panel to study issue: Union Environment Minister
content: As things stand, a complete ban on mining stays with regard to new mining leases or renewal of old mining leases, Bhupender Yadav said

title: Nainar Nagenthran slams DMK govt. over women's safety after alleged sexual assault of seven-year-old girl
content: In a social media post, Mr. Nagenthran said reports of a youth, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, abducting and sexually assaulting the child in Kalugur near Kulithalai were â€œdeeply distressingâ€

title: Lalit Modi issues apology after â€˜biggest fugitives of Indiaâ€™ remark in viral video with Vijay Mallya
content: The apology came days after India said it is committed to bringing back from abroad economic fugitives including Lalit Modi and Mallya to face the law in the country

title: Shah inaugurates â‚¹227 crore redeveloped birthplace of Srimanta Sankardeva
content: Project has been designed not only make the historic site a major tourist attraction but also to reflect the life, ideals, and artistic heritage associated with Mahapurush Sankardeva and the broader cultural traditions of the State

title: Congress welcomes SC decision to stay â€˜100-metre definitionâ€™ of Aravallis
content: The Congress has taken a strong opposition against redefinition, expressing it would destroy the hills by opening them to mining, and real estate projects

title: Turmeric exports from Erode district see 5% rise thanks to sustained global demand
content: Known for its high curcumin content ranging between 2.5% and 3.9%, Erode turmeric has earned a Geographical Indication (GI) tag and remains one of the major crops cultivated in the district

title: Malayalam actor Jayasurya appears before ED in FEMA case probe
content: The actor, accompanied by his wife, is understood to have visited the agency's zonal office as part of a Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) case probe

title: Skill Centre to be set up at KBN College within three months: MP Kesineni Sivanath
content: Addressing an alumni meet organised by the KBN College Old Students Association (KOSA), the MP called upon former students settled across India and abroad to actively contribute to Vijayawadaâ€™s development

title: AIMIM announces candidates for Thane, Vasai-Virar civic polls
content: â€œAs of now, the party has finalised the names of five candidates from Mumbra in Thane city and three candidates from the Vasai-Virar region,â€ says AIMIM president Imtiaz Jaleel

title: Coinbase CEO says ex-employee arrested in India
content: Crypto exchange Coinbaseâ€™s CEO Brian Armstrong announced on social media that an ex-employee was arrested in India

title: LDF regains Pullur-Periya panchayat in Keralaâ€™s Kasaragod after tie-break decided by lots
content: Draw of lots became necessary as both LDF and UDF secured nine votes each in the election. The tie occurred after an elected member abstained from voting

title: L&T bags order related to Hyderabad Greenfield Radial Road
content: Scope of work involves construction of a 3.6 km long viaduct, minor bridges, underpasses and culverts besides others

title: Unnao rape survivor welcomes SC order staying suspension of Kuldeep Sengar's life sentence
content: The Supreme Court on December 29, stayed the Delhi High Court order that had suspended Sengar's life sentence and granted him bail in the 2017 Unnao rape case

title: Four teenagers held for assaulting Maharashtra man in Tamil Naduâ€™s Tiruvallur
content: The accused youths filmed the brutal assault and uploaded the videos on social media platforms in an attempt to make them go viral

title: Tezpur University unrest: Stakeholders stage 24-hr hunger strike to mark 100 days of protest
content: A joint forum of all stakeholders demands the removal of the beleaguered VC for his alleged involvement in corruption and other forms of irregularities, and the start of an inquiry into his actions.

title: Kerala local body polls: Agali panchayat president quits after Congress threatens legal action over election with LDF support
content: Elected from Chinnaparamba ward of Agali panchayat on Congress symbol, Manju became president on Saturday with the support of nine LDF members, drawing the ire of UDF

title: 2025: a year of landmarkÂ acquittals questioning credibility of terror convictionsÂ in India
content: In 2025, courts freed 19 men after years behind bars; Bombay High Court quashed convictions in the 7/11 Mumbai train blasts case, and a special NIA court acquitted all accused in the Malegaon caseÂ

title: Navi Mumbai police bust illegal overseas recruitment agency; seven booked
content: A probe has revealed that the accused were conducting recruitment activities for foreign jobs without a valid licence from the Ministry of External Affairs, an official says

title: Congress councillor Sabarinadhan echoes BJPâ€™s Sreelekha, demands CPI(M) MLA V.K. Prasanth to vacate office in Kerala capital
content: In a Facebook post, Sabarinadhan says Prasanth should be using the facilities in the MLA hostel allotted in his name

title: Supreme Court pauses own judgment defining Aravalli, moots formation of high-powered panel to do a re-think
content: A Bench led by Justice Surya Kant, along with Justices J.K. Maheshwari and A.G. Masih, said a fair, impartial and independent expert opinion must be obtained before any report or court direction is implemented

title: INSV Kaundinya: Navyâ€™s engineless ship sets sail for Oman on maiden voyage
content: INSV Kaundinyaâ€™s project was undertaken through a tripartite agreement between the Ministry of Culture, the Indian Navy and Hodi Innovations as part of Indiaâ€™s efforts to rediscover and revive indigenous knowledge systems.

title: Supreme Court stays Unnao rape convict Kuldeep Sengarâ€™s suspension of life sentence
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for the CBI, argued that Sengar was in a position of dominance and found guilty under POCSO and of killing the victimâ€™s father

title: NCP (SP), NCP join hands for Pune civic polls
content: "After NCP (SP) city chief Prashant Jagtap's exit from party, several workers came to working president Supriya Sule, saying both factions have to come together. decision about the alliance has been taken considering sentiments of local party workers," says NCP leader Rohit Pawar

title: â€˜Is death of 33 BLOs okay?â€™ MP Kapil Sibal takes dig at government
content: Mr. Sibal's remarks came a day after a Booth Level Officer (BLO) was found dead in West Bengal's Bankura district, triggering allegations that work-related pressure linked to the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR)

title: Tripura student murder: Tipra party wing announces â‚¹10 lakh reward for info on prime accused
content: Tipra Motha Party (TMP)-run Tripura Tribal Areas Autonomous District Council (TTAADC) on Dec 29 announced a compensation of â‚¹3 lakh to the family members of the deceased

title: Two youths arrested for sexually abusing minor at rented flat in Keralaâ€™s Kozhikode
content: Police sources said the two reportedly took the girl to rented flat offering food and free stay on Sunday. She was later drugged and sexually abused

title: Adityanath orders closure of schools across Uttar Pradesh till January 1 amid cold wave
content: â€œThe safety of children is paramount during the cold wave, and any negligence in this regard will not be tolerated,â€ says UP CM Adityanath

title: Alaknanda: Indian astronomers spot implausibly old spiral galaxy
content: Alaknandaâ€™s existence poses a significant puzzle for astronomers: it took shape when the universe was only about 1.5 billion years old, defying current models of galaxy formation. According to one expert, either the galaxy grew steadily by drawing in cold gas or it interacted or merged with a smaller companion galaxy

title: Real estate development opened up by Rajasthan's double-engine govt to hurt Aravallis more: Congress
content: "It is not just mining but real estate development that is being opened up by the double-engine sarkar in New Delhi-Jaipur against the recommendations of the Forest Survey of India," Mr. Ramesh said in a post on X

title: Unnao rape case hearing: SC stays suspension of Kuldeep Singh Sengar's sentence, orders legal aid for survivor

title: Aravalli hills hearing updates: Supreme Court keeps its November judgment in abeyance
content: The court issues notice to be heard again on January 21; CJI says a new committee has to be formed to do the survey and study on Aravalli hills

title: Delhi airport sees 128 flight cancellations, 8 diversions due to fog
content: Delhi airport operator said runway visibility is improving, but some flight departures and arrivals may be impacted

title: Chhattisgarh: ED conducts raids in Bharatmala project land acquisition case
content: The case pertains to alleged irregularities in the payment of compensation for the acquisition of land for the Raipur-Vishakhapatnam economic corridor

title: Protests erupt in Tripura over murder of student Angel Chakma in Uttarakhand
content: Angel Chakma, a student from Tripura who was severely assaulted in Dehradun, the capital of Uttarakhand, and later died in the hospital

title: Homo opportunisticus: The contingent, contested evolution of caste
content: Text of a guest lecture by writer Tony Joseph at the 84th annual session of the Indian History Congress at Government Brennen College in Thalassery, Kerala.

title: The man who wore an IAS mask
content: Lalit Kishor faked being an IAS officer, allegedly spending â‚¹5 lakh a month on convoys and staff to take bribes from at least 40 people across four States while promising them government jobs and contracts. Amarnath Tewary visits his family in Bihar, who lives in poverty, and speaks about his early aspirations

title: Tamil Nadu needs to think beyond the metro

title: IndiGo to begin flight services from Tamil Nadu to Navi Mumbai airport from December 29
content: An aviation source said the 186-seat all-economy class Airbus A320 services will be linked to the first phase of the Navi Mumbai airportâ€™s operational hours, from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.

title: Watch: Pakistan President Zardari reveals he was advised to â€˜hide in a bunkerâ€™ during Operation Sindoor
content: Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari has revealed that he was advised to hide in a bunker when India launched Operation Sindoor in May. Speaking at an event marking the 18th death anniversary of former Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto, Zardari recalled the tense moments during the India-Pakistan military escalation and praised Army chief Asim Munirâ€™s response.

title: Punch marked gold coins from Vijayanagara-era unearthed near Jolarpet
content: Revenue officials also apprised the discovery of coins to CollectorÂ K.Â Siva Soundaravalli, who is the custodian of the district treasury as per the Indian Treasure Trove Act, 1878

title: H-1B visa reflects race, class dynamics of modern diaspora, says former JNU professor
content: R. K. Jain says migration shaped by political and cultural factors, and not economics alone, remains central to understanding social inequality

title: Winter bird count conducted in Vellore and nearby districts
content: Forest officials said most of the habitats in these districts are home for local birds that migrate within specified areas round the year

title: What election rules miss about shadow campaigns in India
content: An analysis of digital political advertisements during the Bihar Assembly election shows that third-party actors outspend official parties and candidates and achieve far greater visibility; this creates an accountability gap, allowing opaque funding and influence to persist beyond regulatory oversight

title: S. Krishnaswamy, master chronicler of subcontinental history
content: His magnum opus, the four-hour-long film traversing 5,000 years of subcontinental history, â€˜Indus Valley to Indira Gandhiâ€™, was released in December 1976.

title: Bengal SIR: Many permanently shifted, untraceable voters in Matua-dominated seats, says study

title: Red Fort blast: many victims, kin yet to get govt compensation

title: Uttar Pradesh SIR: Nearly 2.89 crore names deleted from draft voter list

title: Where did the Staubach-Pearson 'Hail Mary' football end up after 50 years?
content: the cowboys beat the Vikings in their 1975 playoff game . it was purported to be the quarterback's touchdown pass from Roger Staubach . he has long wanted a game-worn jersey of a Cowboys' Ring of Honor member .

title: 'Da Niners': 49ers' virtual jabs at Bears lead NFL trolls
content: San Francisco 49ers beat the Chicago Bears 42-38 in a high-scoring "Sunday Night Football" matchup . quarterback Brock Purdy had 303 passing yards and accounted for five touchdowns . 49ers will face the Seattle Seahawks in week 18 for the NFC's no. 1 seed . the 49ers put a 49ers jersey on a Build-A-Bear .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Conner Weigman's four TDs help lead Houston to victory
